title: why are you allowed to play a champ for the first time in ranked?
body: just curious as to why someone who just buys a champ can fucking play him instantly in ranked and fuck his whole team over? like wth can you implement something where you need to own a champ for a certain amount of time or at least have like five wins on the champ before you can just play him in ranked because i am sick and tired of people picking a champ they just bought having no clue how to play them and then feeding the shit out of their lane opponent thus making it ten times harder to fucking win because you have this dead weight who thought it was a good idea to play a champ for the fist time in ranked

replies.body:
Because there's no real way for an automated system to determine how well someone knows a champion. Maybe 5 games is enough to learn how Sona works, but I've played 5 games on Lee and his combo is still finicky. You're going to run into people who play 5 beginner bot games on a champ and then run into ranked or something like that. And then you'd merely get people going 'why do they let people who only played 5 games on that champion to pick them in ranked!?' and you'd raise it to the point no one can play anything.

I do wish they prevented new champs from being in ranked for a week or two though.
There was 1 punctuation in that whole thing.

AP {{champion:31}} (played him as a tank top though). ive played (and carried with) {{champion:25}}, {{champion:111}} , {{champion:57}}, {{champion:43}}, {{champion:16}} before "practicing" them. i just read their abilities and saw other people play them to learn them. 

i did still learn them though, just not by your proposed standard. i learned by watching others. how do you account for that?

edit - i also played AP {{champion:96}}, with the only real practice being aram.

I use to play Katarina all the time when I first bought her but I suck shit with her now. I could prob buy MF right now and play MF better than i could Katarina despite having way more practice with Katarina over the time I've played this game. Just sayin :)

Well depending on your elo, Katarina is permaban in ranked. Maybe that's why you suck with her now, you got rusty but you never get a chance to actually use her and get back into the groove of things.

When you want to learn specific champions, team builder is your best friend.

and i cant play draven no matter how hard i try so i wouldnt play him in ranked because i know i cant play him and would end up feeding sooner or later. the people i am mad about willingly pick a champ that they have never played and dont know if they are going to play well or not thus running the risk that they will feed (kind of a high risk when you know nothing about a champ) and then weighing the rest of the team down. at least if they went and played a few normals first they could get a feel for the champ and possibly understand how well they can do with that champ so they are less of a liability to have on a team.

I understand your frustration.. I just don't see it actually happening.. or rather, fix anything. Because like i said. I could've played a champ a lot before then picked the champ again without any recent practice and suck bricks.
i know you can do that but i would hope that before taking a champ that you are not fresh on into ranked you would try it out in a normal game and get a feel for it again
We would all hope that one is practiced and fresh with a champion they pick for solo q ranked.. but that isn't always the case.

Except that this assumes the only reason to play ranked ever is to climb. I mean sometimes just playing the game is nice, and if I can grind to the rank I want to get to with teammates doing whatever, then why shouldn't I be allowed to do whatever once I get to that rank? If you're still climbing it sets you back a game and you play through it, if you aren't then it gives you something to blame other than your skill for why you aren't climbing and makes you feel better. Self handicapping is a fine way to protect the ego, I'm just giving people something to use for that.
